name: sampleStream
description: Streams a deterministic 1% of public Tweets.

backfill_minutes.description: The number of minutes of backfill requested.

tweet.fields.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.

expansions.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

media.fields.description: A comma separated list of Media fields to display.

poll.fields.description: A comma separated list of Poll fields to display.

user.fields.description: A comma separated list of User fields to display.

place.fields.description: A comma separated list of Place fields to display.

$ul: **data**
**attachments**: Specifies the type of attachments (if any) present in this Tweet.
**media_keys**: A list of Media Keys for each one of the media attachments (if media are attached).
**poll_ids**: A list of poll IDs (if polls are attached).
**author_id**: Unique identifier of this User. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.
**context_annotations**
**conversation_id**: Unique identifier of this Tweet. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.
**created_at**: Creation time of the Tweet.
**edit_controls**
**editable_until**: Time when Tweet is no longer editable.
**edits_remaining**: Number of times this Tweet can be edited.
**is_edit_eligible**: Indicates if this Tweet is eligible to be edited.
**edit_history_tweet_ids**: A list of Tweet Ids in this Tweet chain.
**entities**
**annotations**
**cashtags**
**hashtags**
**mentions**
**urls**
**geo**: The location tagged on the Tweet, if the user provided one.
**coordinates**: A [GeoJson Point](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.2) geometry object.
**coordinates**: A [GeoJson Position](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-3.1.1) in the format `[longitude,latitude]`.
**type**
**place_id**: The identifier for this place.
**id**: Unique identifier of this Tweet. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.
**in_reply_to_user_id**: Unique identifier of this User. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.
**lang**: Language of the Tweet, if detected by Twitter. Returned as a BCP47 language tag.
**non_public_metrics**: Nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.
**impression_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.
**organic_metrics**: Organic nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.
**impression_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.
**like_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.
**reply_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.
**retweet_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.
**possibly_sensitive**: Indicates if this Tweet contains URLs marked as sensitive, for example content suitable for mature audiences.
**promoted_metrics**: Promoted nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.
**impression_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.
**like_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.
**reply_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.
**retweet_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.
**public_metrics**: Engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.
**impression_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.
**like_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.
**quote_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been quoted.
**reply_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.
**retweet_count**: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.
**referenced_tweets**: A list of Tweets this Tweet refers to. For example, if the parent Tweet is a Retweet, a Quoted Tweet or a Reply, it will include the related Tweet referenced to by its parent.
**reply_settings**: Shows who can reply a Tweet. Fields returned are everyone, mentioned_users, and following.
**source**: This is deprecated.
**text**: The content of the Tweet.
**withheld**: Indicates withholding details for [withheld content](https://help.twitter.com/en/rules-and-policies/tweet-withheld-by-country).
**copyright**: Indicates if the content is being withheld for on the basis of copyright infringement.
**country_codes**: Provides a list of countries where this content is not available.
**scope**: Indicates whether the content being withheld is the `tweet` or a `user`.
**errors**
**includes**
**media**
**places**
**polls**
**topics**
**tweets**
**users**
**code**
**message**
